pageContext.description:
'In this picture, the Virgin holds the Christ Child on her knee as the Infant Saint John the Baptist offers Him a bunch of grapes, all seated before a low wall, evoking the hortus conclusus. Behind them, three angels hold aloft a dark green velvet cloth-of-honour, decorated along the edges with floral gold embroidery. Beyond, at left, a wide river crossed by a bridge leads to a distant cityscape, evoking the Holy city of Jerusalem, though conceived as a contemporary Saxon town.'
[Christie's online database: https://www.christies.com/lotfinder/paintings/lucas-cranach-the-younger-the-virgin-and-6238417-details.aspx?; accessed 05.03.2020]

metadata.title: The Virgin and Child with the Infant Saint John the Baptist and Angels

pageContext.provenance:
- M.J. Ruhl, Liège
- Christophe Rhaban Ruhl (1802-1875), Cologne; his sale (†), J.M. Heberle, Cologne, 15 May 1876 (=1st day), lot 15, as 'Lucas Cranach the Elder', illustrated (470 marks)
- anonymous sale: Galerie Georges Giroux, Brussels, 3-4 May 1957, lot 450, as 'Lucas Cranach the Elder'
- with Julius Böhler, Munich, by 1959, as 'Lucas Cranach the Elder'
- anonymous sale (The Property of a Gentleman), Sotheby’s London, 23 March 1960 (=1st day), lot 125, as 'Lucas Cranach the Elder' (V. Lewis)
- acquired in the 1960s, property from the Collection of Gerald Legge, 9th Earl of Dartmouth
- sold by Christie's, London, 03.12.2019, sale 17292, lot 14
[Christie's online database: https://www.christies.com/lotfinder/paintings/lucas-cranach-the-younger-the-virgin-and-6238417-details.aspx?; accessed 05.03.2020]
pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia centre left, on the stone parapet: serpent with dropped wings
